sentences.sContent: Civil war could come if the country breaks up.
sentences.sCn: 如果国家分裂,内战就会来临。

sentences.sContent: Break up the chocolate and melt it.
sentences.sCn: 把巧克力弄碎,使其融化。

sentences.sContent: Police used tear gas to break up a demonstration.
sentences.sCn: 警察使用了催泪瓦斯来驱散示威活动。

synos.tran: 打碎，破碎；结束；解散；衰落

trans.tranOther: When something breaks up or when you break it up, it separates or is divided into several smaller parts
